intro: Cerasus serrulata var. pubescens, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and prefers well-drained, slightly acidic soils. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and landscapes.
